text: rated for food contact, low flow
There's also a weight-based solution <https://www.sparkfun.com/tutorials/144>
I'd like to set up some sort of web api, to encompass stories like "what's on tap now?" "how much is left?" "what would people like to see on tap next?"
in addition to analytics on how quickly beer is poured, what times of day, avg length of pour...basically anything we can think of
I think there is a load cell on the bench.. bought for glaze in case we want to measure shelf weight

drive them from RPi

with info on how much is in there, type, ABV, IBUs
faucets that open and close with a solenoid, not based on teh tap handle position. then some RFID and you can forbid certain people from drinking certain things

If we run into a frozen line problem on the rightmost, I guess we could try running the line through the door itself with an elbow shank <http://www.beveragefactory.com/draftbeer/faucets/shanks/stainless_elbow_shank.html>
But that makes cleaning that line much more difficult
Although if we're making a custom backplate for the door anyway, we could allow for an elbow shank...
